column2: §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can use this Casus Belli to subjugate the §Y$TITLE$§! as a rightful part of the Byzantine Empire, either forcing the holder to become a vassal or seizing the title if they cannot become one. If the §Y$TITLE$§! is not held, all de jure counties in §Y$TARGET$§!'s realm will either be vassalized or seized.

column2: My manifest destiny allows me to invade §Y$TARGET$§!. If successful, everything §Y$TARGET$§! controls within the §Y$TITLE$§! will be taken or vassalized.
column3: Ma destinée manifeste me donne le droit d'envahir §Y$TARGET$§!. En cas de réussite, tout territoire contrôlé par §Y$TARGET$§! au sein du/de la §Y$TITLE$§! sera capturé ou vassalisé.
column4: Mein manifestiertes Schicksal erlaubt mir, §Y$TARGET$§! zu erobern. Bei Erfolg, wird alles, was §Y$TARGET$§! in §Y$TITLE$§! kontrolliert, übernommen oder zum Vasallen.
column6: Mi destino manifiesto me permite invadir §Y$TARGET$§!. De tener éxito, todo lo que §Y$TARGET$§! controla en los §Y$TITLE$§! Será tomado o avasallado.

column2: The Carolingian Empire must be restored! §Y$CLAIMANT$§! may use this Casus Belli to seize all titles held by §Y$TARGET$§! within the de jure §Y$TITLE$§!, with the goal of rebuilding the Holy Roman Empire which has so recently been lost.
column3: The Carolingian Empire must be restored! §Y$CLAIMANT$§! may use this Casus Belli to seize all titles held by §Y$TARGET$§! within the de jure §Y$TITLE$§!, with the goal of rebuilding the Holy Roman Empire which has so recently been lost.

column2: As a Merchant Republic, §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to seize control of the coastal city of §Y$TITLE$§!.

column2: We can conquer nearby counties without specific reasons.
column3: Les païens peuvent conquérir les comtés frontaliers sans raison spécifique. Les païens nordiques peuvent aussi s’emparer de tout comté côtier.
column4: Heiden können einzelne, angrenzende Länder ohne Grund erobern. Nordische Heiden können zudem jede Küstenregion einnehmen.
column6: Los Paganos pueden conquistar condados fronterizos únicos sin razones específicas. Los Paganos Nórdicos también pueden tomar cualquier condado costero.

column2: If the Crown of §Y$TITLE$§! is not held by a ruler of our faith, all gains will be handed over to the ruler who contributes the most to the war.
column3: Si la Couronne de §Y$TITLE$§! n'est point portée par un souverain de votre foi, tous les gains seront remis au souverain ayant le plus contribué à la guerre.
column4: Falls die Krone von §Y$TITLE$§! nicht von jemandem unseres Glaubens gehalten wird, gehen alle Gewinne an denjenigen, der das meiste zum Krieg beigetragen hat.
column6: If the Crown of §Y$TITLE$§! is not held by a ruler of our faith, all gains will be handed over to the ruler who contributes the most to the war.

column2: If the Crown of §Y$TITLE$§! is not held by a ruler of our faith, all gains will be handed over to the ruler who contributes the most to the war.

column2: Defending against a Crusade allows us to call on more troops from our vassals.
column3: Se défendre contre une croisade nous permet de faire appel à davantage de troupes de nos vassaulx.
column4: Weil wir gegen einen Kreuzzug verteidigen, können wir mehr Truppen von unseren Vasallen aufrufen.
column6: Defending against a Crusade allows us to call on more troops from our vassals.

column2: If the ruling dynasty's decadence grows too high, revolts amongst the pious members of their people may arise against them.
column3: If the ruling dynasty's decadence grows too high, revolts amongst the pious members of their people may arise against them.
column4: If the ruling dynasty's decadence grows too high, revolts amongst the pious members of their people may arise against them.
column6: If the ruling dynasty's decadence grows too high, revolts amongst the pious members of their people may arise against them.

column2: As we are fighting a defensive war, our vassals are obligated to provide us with more troops than they otherwise would.
column3: Lorsque nous nous battons dans une guerre défensive, nos vassaulx sont obligés de nous fournir plus de troupes qu'à l'accoutumée.
column4: Da wir mit einem Verteidigungskrieg kämpfen, werden unsere Vasallen verpflichtet, uns mit mehr Truppen zu versorgen, als sie sonst würden.
column6: As we are fighting a defensive war, our vassals are obligated to provide us with more troops than they otherwise would.

column2: The §Y$TITLE$§! is, de jure, a vassal of §Y$CLAIMANT$'s§!, which is cause enough for war.

column4: §Y$TITLE$§! Ist ein de jure-Vasall von §Y$CLAIMANT$§! - Grund genug für einen Krieg.
column6: El §Y$TITLE$§! es, de iure, vasallo de §Y$CLAIMANT$§!, lo cual es motivo suficiente de guerra.

column2: We can force them to abandon their Antipope

column2:
This Casus Belli can be used by §Y$PRESSER$§! to press §Y$CLAIMANT$'s§! claim on the §Y$TITLE$§!.

§Y$CLAIMANT$§! will become your vassal if one of the following conditions are true:
- §Y$PRESSER$§! and §Y$CLAIMANT$§! are of the same dynasty.
- §Y$TITLE$§! is a lower rank than §Y$CLAIMANT$§!'s primary title.
- §Y$PRESSER$§! is de jure liege of §Y$TITLE$§!.
column3:
Ce casus belli peult estre utilisé par le(la) §Y$PRESSER$§! pour appuyer la revendication de §Y$CLAIMANT$§! vis-à-vis du(de la) §Y$TITLE$§!

§Y$CLAIMANT$§! deviendra votre vassal si une des conditions suivantes est réunie :
- §Y$PRESSER$§! et §Y$CLAIMANT$§! font partie de la mesme dynastie.
- §Y$TITLE$§! est un rang plus bas que le titre principal de §Y$CLAIMANT$§!.
- §Y$PRESSER$§! est le souverain de jure de §Y$TITLE$§!.

column2: Tribes do not bother with just causes - might makes right!
column3: Les tribus font fi des causes justes, elles règnent par la force !
column4: Stämme kümmern gerechte Sachen nicht - es gilt das Recht des Stärkeren!
column6: Las tribus no pierden el tiempo con causas justas. ¡Es el poderoso quien determina lo que es justo!
